Text: Congrats to all @MichStatePolice grads & special thanks to Thomas Jorgensen, Brett Robinson, and Justin Van Nuil for dedicating their lives to protecting us here in SW MI. Great things to come from these bright Michiganders! #MI06 https://t.co/gnusxcwyrg

Today the White House called Russia’s predatory actions an invasion - a long overdue observation. Now, President Biden must deploy crippling sanctions against Putin and his regime. This is a world-wide test of democracy, and we must not fail. https://t.co/x3zQ1hzFdV

"There is no limit to the amount of good you can do if you don't care who gets the credit." 

On Presidents’ Day I'm remembering my former boss President Ronald Reagan. His steadfast leadership brought peace and prosperity across our nation and the world. https://t.co/9KEXzgsn9F
Last night I joined @WWMTAndyD to discuss everything from the good things coming to Michigan because of the BIF to the ongoing situation with Russia and Ukraine.  #MI06 https://t.co/zm92ZSMR3e

Frank was always on his game whether it be in the Michigan football broadcasting booth or with his show on the political front on WJR…his passion for sports and this country was 2nd to none. A broadcaster hall of famer for certain. https://t.co/oBTEy440fO

Too many SW MI families have lost a loved one to a drug overdose. The Opioid Commission finalized our evidence-based solutions to combat the flow of opioids from across the southern border that destroy our communities. https://t.co/WotctWnwto

Today, on #WorldCancerDay, I am relaunching the bipartisan Congressional Caucus on the Deadliest Cancers with Rep. Anna Eshoo. Together, we'll have all hands on deck to find a cure for the incurable and save millions of lives from these fatal diseases. https://t.co/GUsv7noZCs
Looks like a harsh few days up ahead. Stay warm, stay safe, and stay off the roads if you can! https://t.co/5RahMGygFK

Great news! The FDA has fully approved the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine. If you haven’t been vaccinated yet, make an appointment to do so today. #MI06

This month I helped introduce the Invest to Protect Act to provide necessary resources to our local law enforcement. It will provide better pay, training, & tools to boost recruitment. I am grateful for their service & will always have their backs. #MI06 https://t.co/t1YbGtNv7j

Today we remember the 6 million Jewish lives lost in the Holocaust and the countless lives that were changed forever. We must never forget and never repeat one of the darkest periods of human history. #HolocaustRemembranceDay

Flat-out wrong that millions are still waiting on overdue tax returns from 2021. Folks & small biz rely on their return to make ends meet. That’s why I signed onto a letter w/ over 100 of my colleagues to hold Sec. Yellen accountable & fix the issues that caused this backlog.

Today I met with folks from Hope College’s TRIO Upward Bound Program. I have long supported this program that truly makes a difference. TRIO provides resources for students from diverse backgrounds who will be the first in their family to graduate from college. #TRIOworks! https://t.co/8oQios7eYL
Happy Birthday, Michigan! The Great Lakes State joined the Union 185 years ago, today. https://t.co/AMGDrmjNyx

Great reception with the local Southwest Michigan Association of Health Underwriters where I was introduced by President Robert Williams today. These folks provide a critical link between businesses, consumers and healthcare providers. #MI06 https://t.co/2lM1rEaNMJ

Met with the Home Builders Association of Western MI in KZOO today. Discussed challenges facing our community such as labor shortages, supply chain & unprecedented inflation. We need to use every tool in the toolbox to overcome these issues affecting Michiganders every day. #MI06 https://t.co/Lj5uzTpuOi

Calls to defund the police are flat out wrong. Our law enforcement folks need resources for better pay, training, and equipment, like body cameras, to help them properly and safely do their jobs. The bipartisan Invest to Protect Act does just that. 
https://t.co/U0HnrQid7d

Proud to have supported our veterans today by voting for the EVEST Act. This important bipartisan bill will help millions of veterans access VA medical care through automatic enrollment. After all, we are the home of the Free because of our Brave! 🇺🇸

Education really is an irreplaceable investment. I’m proud to see several of our local schools ranked in the top 50 middle and elementary schools across the state - this wouldn’t be possible without our dedicated educators! #MI06 https://t.co/eyEayIx929

Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. was a trailblazer and civil rights icon who fought to make our country a better and more just place. His life and legacy will forever shape our history. And while we've made progress in the nearly 54 years since his death, our work is far from over.

…Successfully unhooking the BBB from the BIF allowed us to truly focus on what this country really needed versus more unchecked inflationary spending. #MI06

…in new social spending that would never go away was never going to attract Republican support and Senator Manchin’s realization of such now ends this long chapter with inflation concerns near the top of the list…

…that we simply could not kick the can down the road and do nothing to fix our crumbling infrastructure past another election or two, but instead prioritize what we could do now in a bipartisan way - actually governing in this gridlocked Congress. Attempting to add trillions…

…proper framework addressing true infrastructure needs such as highways, roads, bridges, water, broadband, and energy infrastructure as well as a way to pay for it without raising taxes or adding to the deficit or debt unlike the Trump or Biden COVID relief packages. We knew…

THREAD: Senator Manchin was an integral part in writing the Bipartisan Infrastructure bill (BIF), which overwhelmingly passed the Senate in August 69-30 and then the House in November. From the start, he and the bipartisan House Problem Solvers Caucus met at length to work on a…
